text: We actually had a decent meal here at baja miguel's the other day. They have a daily lunch special from 11-3 daily that includes a frozen margarita, fideo soup, and your choice of two items to make up your entree that comes with rice and beans. The chips and salsa also come with bean dip and guac. I think its actually a pretty good deal if you are close by and especially since the special is seven days a week.
The staff was nice, but the food was okay, barely. Guacamole and salsa were straight out of a can and all the food was overly saturated with cheese.  Don't eat there....

Very gluten free friendly. Jason, the head manager, took special care to cater to both gf and df allergies. Knowledgeable. Excellent service, smart enough to split up a huge bill, good drinks, well done.
Flavorless, tasteless & overpriced. Service is marginal food even less then marginal. Good if you like things covered in cheese. BTW the charge you if you want more chips.

The food here is surprisingly good.  We had low expectations after trying the chips and salsa.  The salsa and guacamole are bland and boring and we don't end up eating them, but I thought the bean dip was addictive. My husband had the fajitas and the beef was really well seasoned.  I have had the carne asada tampiquena which was good, as well as cheese enchilada and pork tamale which I also enjoyed. They went a little masa heavy on the tamale but the meat was great. 

Wish they would improve their salsa, for sure, but we will definitely return.

Went to Baja Miguel's in the South Point Hotel in Las Vegas for their lunch special.  Had a really good lunch - for $9.95 you get a margarita, chips with guacamole, salsa & bean dip, plus a cup of their fideo soup and choice of two entree items.  Everything was good except the margarits could have been a lot better.

We ordered the fajita salad with steak. Not much steak, lukewarm at best, and a ton of iceberg lettuce which was supposed to be mixed greens. We asked for additional salsa and beans for our chips and found out that lukewarm beans would cost $2 additional. Here's a photo of the size of bowl it was. Then, paying our bill with a shift change was a joke too. We'll never come back here again!

Yummy yummy!!  Recently moved to Vegas, this is the only real sit down Mexican Food Restaurant we have found!  The bean dip, guacamole, and salsa with chips is outstanding!  Parradillas Del Norte was SO GOOD!  Chimichanga delicious!!  Highly recommend, good atmosphere, good music, great service!!
The Carne A La Plancha is horrible.  First the carne is not a la plancha. Its little pieces of meat soaked in what tastes like campbells minestrone soup. It's gross.
Their food was gross. I ate there today and their pork burrito was super dry and hard as if it were microwaved and served. Never eating here again.

Absolutely wonderful experience! The staff were fabulous particularly our waiter Miguel. Their lunch special is a steal at $9.95 which includes a margarita. Portion size was perfect for lunch all authentic Mexican food. Fresh tortilla chips arrive with three dips-guacamole, bean dip and fresh salsa, all part of the lunch special. Chicken enchiladas were delicious, as was the Mexican/Spanish rice and refried beans that accompanied. Next time in Vegas I will be back!

OK so the reviews of others I can not speak to and haven't read them.  But I will say this is my spot when I come to Vegas. Thing is I love how it all starts.  The fact I can get Guac,  Beans and salsa to start is a win for me. I am not saying you don't have to get a starter but I don't sometimes due to the fact I have had most of them (great by the way) and I gorge myself on the trio mentioned above.  Anyway if you like good Mexican and want the whole in the wall taste and value enjoy.  The portions are not ridiculously huge as you get in some places but I like that because in Vegas I don't ever want to intentionally hurt myself unless it is a buffet.  Give them a try good staff nice vibe!

Sat at the bar bc we had a show to see and the wait was 30 minutes. Good margaritas, not very strong. Complimentary Chips, bean dip salsa and guacamole that were just ok. The guacamole was thick and didn't taste like anything I'd ever had. Would of just gone for the salsa, but they charge for reorder and the amount they gave was too small. Chicken and beef combo enchiladas were decent. Chicken fajitas looked good and my mom said the tortillas were yummy! A lot more peppers and onions than chicken. Service was great and bartender very attentive and happy. Would return

Hmmmm......

Went for the happy hour special that says 5pm to 7pm on their website (and it's still up as I type). I get there at 6:05 and they said it's 4pm to 6pm now....WTF?

Can't order full menu at the bar,only "bar menu"...WTF?
Can't order happy hour drinks at the table...WTF?
Chips, salsa and guac free at the table, but $4.95 at the bar...WTF?

Sat at a table and ordered the chicken fajitas, at $16.95 that's pretty steep for being 5 miles off the main strip...I give them a 5 on a scale of 1 to 10...average but decent portion.

Salsa average, decent guac, fresh chips

Unless your staying at this hotel, there are much better options, at better prices with REAL happy hours.

Baja Miguel's has been a local favorite of our family for about 7 years and we've been steady customers.  We've always enjoyed the food for the value and we've referred countless friends to the restaurant.  We ate there tonight for an early Father's Day celebration.  We were shocked to learn that when we requested more chips and salsa, we'd be charged $7.95 for the next round.  Huh?  Then my mom requested a little extra lettuce with her taco and she was informed that would cost $1.75.  At that we asked for the manager.  We have never incurred such charges before and the manager, who was not the regular manager we're accustomed to dealing with, told us they have been charging for those items for a long time.  Wrong!  We have never once been charged for extra chips and salsa or for a little extra lettuce.  Although we enjoyed our meals, to the tune of $80 with tip for 4, I don't think we'll be coming back here any time soon.  I understand times are tough, but come on!  We're not the type of folks who complain about paying money for decent food and we tip well.  But when a restaurant starts being so tight about every little item, it takes the fun out of going there.  Too bad.

Shredded beef chimi was tasty. Nice touch of bringing out salsa, bean dip and guacamole with the chips. 
Service was very good. Food was not a accurately described in menu but the server corrected my dish.
I like the free fideo soup and free margaritas Wednesday through Sunday from 11:00am to 5:00pm.  Yummy.

Food: Great food.
Rating: Four stars

Service: Excellent service.  Attentive, no pressure.
Rating: Five stars

Atmosphere: Fun, lively atmosphere.
Rating: Five stars

Location: The South Point Casino location is not on The Strip.  This is an advantage and disadvantage.
Rating: Four stars

Went here for dinner last night. They started off by up-selling their Cadillac margarita. We understood why after having a pitcher of their house margaritas. Sugar sweet and watered down it was by far the WORST margarita we've ever had! So bad hat we had to send it back. The second sign of a bad restaurant was the guacamole, salsa and bean dip set out with chips. It all tasted and looked like it came straight from a can. The dishes came out and were not much better. Sadly, this place is in need of a major facelift if it has plans of ever being good.

Let me start by saying my family eats a lot of Mexican food. The atmosphere is very nice and relaxing. Our waiter,Abraham, was a very good waiter and very attentive. They give you chips with 3 dips when you sit down. The chips and the bean dip are excellent the guacamole and salsa are OK. The burritos are really good! Actually all the food we orders was very good. My wife, Bobbi, said the cheese enchiladas were excellent! The steak meals are amazing! Every time we visit Vegas we will be eating here and I would recommend this restaurant to everyone!

I really enjoy their enchiladas I normally get the lunch special for 10 bucks and you get 2 enchiladas  or 2 tacos beans and rice, soup and a margarita. So if you want a nice quick cheap but good tasting lunch then this is the perfect Mexican restaurant awesome customer service.

Been eating at Baja Miguel's for years.  The cheese enchiladas are great! Strawberry frozen Margaritas are tasty. The chips and salsa come with bean dip and guacamole standard. This is one of my favorite Mexican restaurants anywhere!

Love this place! Instead of just chips and salsa they serve chips, salsa, guacamole, and bean dip!! Yay! Great way to please your customers. My carnitas were delicious! Defiinitely will be eating there on my next trip to Vegas!

Well we are Latin but in the mexicant place we felt discriminate be a Mexican lady 
Bad bad servicio all around ..

I didn't expect much and I got what I would
Have made at home. It was like everything I ordered was taken directly off the Sysco truck, plated and heated up. The guacamole had the consistency of the bags you buy Costco, refried beans were canned, the salsa was pace picante sauce, the chicken tacos were American style and dry, the ceviche had no lime flavor and the margaritas were made with "finest call margarita mix" just like on the casino floor. 
  
I think Baja Miguel is from the midwest.

I ordered a soft taco with meat and cheese and nothing healthy, and a Cheese Enchilada with nothing healthy, when I got my food they both had lettuce and tomato on them. Did not enjoy them, will not be back.

Best lunch value in Las Vegas. You are served chips and 3 different dips (bean, salsa and avocado). Then out comes Fideo soup. You get to choose 2 items (Tacos - crispy or soft shell, Burritos or Chili Relleno). The meat can be beef (shredded or ground), pork or chicken. You also get a Margarita included with your lunch. Since I have to return to work, I always ask for a Virgin Strawberry Margarita. One of my favorite place to eat!

The wet chicken burrito and chimichanga are my go to menu items and the bean dip is outrageous!

The warm chips and dip trio is definitely worth the trip every time!

Baja Miguel's is worth checking out one Saturday night...perhaps before you catch a movie.

This place has great food and it isn't too expensive. It is obviously not very kid friendly as they have no kid menu at all, but we went with two young tots and they were accommodating. Great to go with your family or just for a date night.

My husband and I grabbed a quick bite here after bowling on a Sunday afternoon. We were hesitant because of their current "star status" but we were very pleased! We sat in the bar area because at 4:00pm they start $3.00 frozen margaritas. The margaritas are great not too sweet which is pretty common when it comes to a cheap frozen margarita! My husband ordered chicken nachos and we got a side of diablo sauce (which is a must try if you like
spice). We will definitely return to try more items on the menu!

Bland tasteless paste
I was expecting a lot more
Portion are good sized 
Service was just ok

Terrific Mexican eatery located inside South Point Casino. Greatly enjoyed the warm chips that were brought out to the table after we sat down. They come with salsa, bean dip, and guacamole at NO extra charge. All 3 condiments were very good and it was nice to have a variety. I chose the steak Tacos al Carbon as my entree and it was delicious and quite filling. Steak was quite tender and perfectly seasoned. It came with sides of beans and rice. I didn't get to try the margaritas, but the table next to us had them and they looked really good! I will definitely come back to try other dishes, and to enjoy those yummy chips and a margarita!

always the first dinner of the Vegas stay while at southpoint! love the free margarita  coupon, and the trio of dips with the chips...ordered the 2 taco meal, but the waiter brought me the 3 taco plate, saying it was the same price..have always known this, but thought it was nice of him to give me the better bargain lol....all Southpoint stays will always include a meal here!

Had a great time here with my family and friends celebrating a milestone birthday. Pre-planned the whole party with the staff. All went beautifully. The staff were right on top of things the whole evening. Everyone loved the food. Good job.

Having just gotten in from out of town and having a coupon for a free margarita with a meal, we decided to give it a try. The drinks were great and refills were reasonably priced. The food, too, was tasty and ample, but it's presentation wasn't great. Everything LOOKED the same. The prices were quite fair, especially for a restaurant in a hotel/casino. The wait staff was attentive. Overall I'd go again and bring friends.

OMG this is the best Mexican food and restaurant ever! I love it all the service the margarita free with lunch 10 bucks for 2 item rice beans soup and margarita! where on earth can u go get that and it all taste so good I went twice this trip. Love it all

I ate at Baja Miquels 2 days ago and loved it. I order the filet mignon with tequila cream sauce and it was cooked perfectly. 2 3oz petite filets rice and beans and a delicious shrimp on top. Great price. Good service. Can't wait to go back.
Great family restaurant. Loved the chips, salsa, bean dip and guacamole served complimentary. Ground beef tacos were the bomb!

Terrible food. Went right before they closed and had the seafood salad and my son had the enchiladas. The salad was covered in a white sauce which made it uneatable.The seafood was limp and tasteless. The enchiladas were served room temperature like the cooks were in a hurry to go home. DO NOT EAT here as you will be very disappointed. I could not believe that the South Point Hotel would have an eatery like this in it.

Meh, have had much much better Mexican food. This is what I call mid west west Mexican. it's great Mexican food because most of it back there sort of sucks. service was fine. I  just couldn't give it a higher rating because the salsa was horrendous. it looked and tasted like that crap out of a jar. You just can't pull stuff and call yourself a good Mexican food restaurant. Better sales and maybe a three star.

I really enjoyed our stay at the casino but this restaurant was a disappointment.  The food was not inspiring at all.  I have rarely been to a Mexican restaurant where both me and the person I was with ate less than half of the meal.  Our waiter seemed to want to be somewhere else.  Go to the Casino but avoid Baja Miguels.

The food is ok. I appreciate the chips with sides of bean dip, salsa, and guacamole was placed on the table when we sat down. The staff was friendly. The female 'busser' wore a scented lotion that was very strong and competed with the smell of the food. I mentioned this to her and she made excuses about her hands being dry instead of washing it off. The staff kept talking about how they wanted chocolate that the man from the reservation booth was carrying around in a bag. It is noisy in the restaurant and you can overhear other diner's conversations. They have tables with armless chairs and booths.
Great food and service. The happy hour margaritas are worth heading there a little early( 4-6pm).

Hostess was the best part of the experience. She was friendly and helpful. Service wasn't bad but seemed to lack. Complimentary chips and salsa and guacamole seemed to not be as fresh as I've had at other Mexican restaurants. I had the seafood enchiladas, very good. Rice was horrible and hard that I spit it back in my napkin. My boyfriend had the burrito and took a couple bites and was over it. Sub par Mexican food, service lacked as I watched one couple sit and not get greeted for ten minutes, then they left without service.

Food was decent but Vicente our server was a real jerk.  It was our first night at the South Point and the only reason we stayed was because my parents were curious about it.  I work like a dog as a bartender in a Mexican Food restaurant and I was excited to start my night off at a place that seems highly recommended.  
We got to the host stand and a little old lady greeted us but had very little personality.  She gave us a buzzer and told us it would be about a 20-30 minute wait.  That's cool cause I'm on vacation and I am in no rush.  We get seated and a busser promptly asks us if we want something to drink so I get a margarita on the rocks, my girlfriend gets an iced tea, and our 9 year old son gets a virgin piña colada.  About 5 minutes later Vicente shows up and asks what we want to drink and the busser tells him.  That seems off that they have a busser ask when it is the waiters responsibility.  We eventually get our drinks and the margarita was strong and I was in a great mood.  Vicente took some time to get to us and we got our food orders in.  Now we have our food and it is just okay.  We get our bill and I give Vicente the free margarita coupon the hotel gives you in those silly discount books you pay for with the stupid hotel fee.  He gets mad and says "what is that?" I tell him and he gets even more upset and calls over the manager and says "what am I suppossed to do with this?"  The manager miraculously gives me the free margarita.  Turns out the free margarita is suppossed to be given to them before you order so that they can give you the water down garbage.  I got the real deal and that irked Vicente quite a bit it looks like.  So if you want a real margarita and can take Vicentes funky little attitude then give him the coupon at the end.  I told the manager how he acted and her and some other server acted like they could care less.  Thanks Baja Miguel!
The Bean dip was amazing and service was awesome !! The rest of the the food was not over exciting and the restaurant itself had no charm at all ....

I have been in Las Vegas over a week now with family & this place, just love the bar area. I had been here, but it had been years! The happy hour if fantastic with 3 dollar margaritas from 4 to 6, with your choice of frozen and on the rocks, and several flavors. This is only Wednesday thru Sunday, as they are closed Monday and Tuesday.  If you have a chance to go, stick to Roberto, the Cuban bartender, he makes geat drinks, very attentive, and such a doll. He is the short, thin one,  with the cute smile.  Yes, I did try other cocktails, late in the evening and they were good as well.  Chips and Salsa were average, the beans seemed straight out of a can,  the salsa not spicy, and the guacamole was good.  My cousin-in-law said her chicken quesadilla was good.  I will be back in the future!

An awesome jewel at the Southpoint Hotel & Casino. Looking for decent south of the border treats? This place is not as busy at lunch time if you arrive for early lunch. The lunch deals are amazing...$9.99 for two combination plate and a margarita. You cannot beat that kind of bargain especially when the food is also very tasty. If you come with the expectation of an eatery you won't be disappointed.
Nit terrible,  but nothing special at all.  Wanted real mexican food,  didn't find it here.  Overpriced for the quality,  service was Ok

We ate here last night the place was
packed and considering the place was packed the service was good but as far as the food is considered the food has no flavor I order the steak and chicken Fajitas and the meat had no flavor it wasn't seasoned at all it was flat and considering it was a 20 dollar meal by itself I expected better also my wife's flautas dinner combination with beef tacos as well had no flavor, it's pretty bad when the best tasting thing of the meal was the beans. Won't ever try this place ever again. The 2 stars was for the service because the service was good but the food sucked.

Just got back from the first time there, on Cinco De Mayo. As you will see in several reviews, the decor of the room is not much. It comes off mostly like a banquet or meeting room that had some light conversions to make it a restaurant. Anyway-the food. They had a couple of special going-shrimp tacos or carne asada steak and chees enchilada. The enchilada was not good. Dry, no sauce, not much flavor. The carne asada however, was about as good as I could imagine--lot's of good flavor. My wife had the shrimp tacos and kind of gave them an 'ehhh'. Overall, three stars for me. A sign of a great restaurant for me is ---would I pass by like restaurants to go to this one'. For me, the anwer is no.

Baja Miguel's is like a Chi-Chi's.  That is not meant as a compliment or a slam.  It is simply a restaurant that provides adequate Mexican dishes in a setting that mildly tips its hat to Mexican heritage, for a modest price.

They take reservations on Open Table (there is a link to it from the Yelp review page, or you can use the Open Table app), which should help with those reviewers who complained about the wait.

Set upstairs in the South Point casino in a windowless chamber, the decorators did their best with what they had to work with.  There is a pink sunset painted on the far wall as you enter, with french doors to simulate the existence of the outdoors.  

Contrary to other reviewers, our servers were neither inattentive nor doting; they came by periodically, provided what we needed within a reasonable time of being asked, but occasionally we found ourselves waiting for one thing or another.

The food was fine.  Not knock-your-socks-off great, nor revoltingly bad, just ok.  As I wrote above - about the quality one would expect to find at a Chi-Chi's (BTW, for those of you who don't get the reference, Chi-Chi's was a mediocre chain of Mexican restaurants that went out of business in the U.S., but can still be found in Europe, where they still don't know what Mexican food is supposed to taste like).

Anyway, bottom line, if you're in the market for a just-ok Mexican meal, for a so-so price, Baja Miguel's is a fine choice.  I would go again.

My date and I enjoyed our meals very much.  I had the chicken chimichanga which was loaded with big chunks of chicken.  My date had the chili rolleno and was raving about his.  Very generous portions and everything was fresh especially being we came in right before they were closing (yes we were THOSE people, lol).  The chips with the bean dip, guacamole, and salsa at the beginning sealed the deal for me.  House margarita with Grand Marnier on top was good sized and packed a punch too.  Sure, it's more Americanized Mexican but I'm a fan and will be back.

We were looking for a casual meal after seeing a movie at the South Point Hotel. Baja Miguel seem to fit the bill. This was rodeo week in Vegas and the South Point was absolutely jammed at every corner. We went upstairs to see if they would be able to get a party of four in in a reasonable amount of time. The hostess told us it would be about 10 minutes. We decided to wait for the table. About five minutes our beeper was going off and we were seated. Almost immediately, one of our servers brought a basket of chips with three dipping sauces: guacamole, salsa and refried beans. The salsa was very tasty but a little spicier than I cared for. The guacamole and the beans were absolutely delicious. My wife and I decided to share an order of  chicken fajitas. Because we were sharing the server brought us an extra potion of tortillas at no charge. The sizzling platter was filled with chicken, sauteed onions, and sliced peppers. They also had sides of sour cream, guacamole, beans, and rice. The flour tortillas with fresh and incredibly tasty. Overall it made for a absolutely terrific meal. One of the best the fajitas I've had in a long time. And the portion was more than enough to share. The price was ridiculously reasonable. I will be back here again after a movie in the near future.

Food: 3.5 Stars
Service: 0 stars

I ate here while staying at South Point Hotel in Vegas and was quite disappointed by the way my meal turned out. The food was pretty decent with the hearty portions and a killer chips and dip, but the service was dreadful. We waited forever to order our food and didn't get our water until mid-way through the meal. Our waiter kept apologizing for how slow the service is (clearly a bad sign) and in the end we just gave the bill to the bus boy after waiting forever for our waiter. I would not recommend this place.

Its not about the atmosphere really. Its the food!! They give you comp chips with guacamole, salsa, and bean dip. All so very good! Wed-Sun they have a $9.95 lunch special that includes a 2 item combo, fideo soup (also yum!!), and a frozen margarita! You cant beat that.

The short story: good food, lousy service. In fact, I had the best flautas I've ever eaten! I was at the hotel for a convention, and I'm not sure if they weren't prepared for an influx of people or if our server was just inexperienced, but we were very poorly cared for. Our waitress wouldn't return to our table, so we had to ask the manager twice for our check---and we asked two other servers who passed, as well. When our waitress finally came with the check (after 40 MINUTES of waiting), we asked her to stay and take our payment. She said no, she had food to get for other patrons. We implored her, so she took our credit cards to the back---then delivered other food and didn't run our cards for almost 10 more minutes. I can't remember the last time I experienced such terrible service! The good food is the only thing saving this review!

I have been here several times since 2014 for the Arabian Breeders World Cup and eat here every time. Some of the best Mexican food I have ever had, and the service is amazing. Get the Bloody Maria, you will not be disappointed.

My husband, baby and I where staying at southpoint and upon checkin received 2 coupon booklets for things inside the hotel. I was worried at first thinking we would not have a family place to eat the wasn't a buffet but we saw a coupon for a free margarita and soup with entree purchase at miguels.

We waited only a couple minutes without reservations and where seated with accommodations for our baby stroller which was great and the waiter was happy to serve us. Sometimes people are rude lately because we have a stroller or carseat and it's an extra thing in their way but they where awesome here.

We tried strawberry and raspberry frozen margaritas first and they where good. Not too strong but delicious and not too sweet. They give you a giant basket of chips with free guac, beans and salsa which is so unheard of. Ordered basic Mexican food and before our meal they brought us some awesome soup (forgot the name) but it reminded me of Mexican spagheti-o's.

Round two of margaritas went great and they where even stronger than the first! All the employees came by and mentioned how cute our baby was which makes it easier to go out when you don't feel like a burden. 

Dinner was good and large portions. Slightly dissapointed with the flavor of the Chile Verde being sort or bland but I did order mild so could be my fault.

Super inexpensive and cozy delicious place

Blah. Lots of food. Lots of really bland food. Salsa was flavorless. Mashed beans masquerading as refried bean dip. And the soup tastes like a wet dog smells. Howard Johnson style decor. Chipotle is better, and that is saying a lot. Second the opinions on the the weird tag teaming service.

Their daily special us a bargain! For $9.99 you get chips with salsa, beans, and guacamole. Fideo soup, entree with two choices, rice, and beans. It includes a frozen margarita. Being Mexican, I'm picky about restaurant Mexican food but their chile rellenos are so good! The soup and beans are also good. The guacamole, rice, and cheese enchiladas not so much. But there's plenty of food on the plate so you won't go hungry. Service is great and the margaritas are awesome! They don't skimp on the alcohol and they are so flavorful, they even taste good after they melt. We come here every time we're in town.

Baja Miguel's has some good Mexican at an okay price. Not the best Mexican food I have ever had, but certainly not the worst. The tray of dipping items is nice and their guacamole is good. 

The wait time can get lengthy the later you wait to go. It's best to get there earlier in the evening. The hostess we had was very rude. She acted as if we were imposing on her time by even coming. Our waitress was nice, but never seemed to be around. My husband's glass was empty twice and we had to ask for the refills. 

Again, the food is good but don't expect exceptional service.

While on vacation with family, we decided to try out Baja Miguel's. I have a gluten intolerance (not celiac) so I'm used to limited options while eating out. When I asked the hostess if they had a gluten free menu, the answer was no. I was fully prepared to figure something out on my own but she quickly told me they would accommodate me. When we were seated, I was told I could eat the chips and salsa but not the guacamole or beans because of how they were prepared. I was ecstatic that they were so informed and really seemed to care about my concerns. They even brought me my own bean dip without gluten.

When Octavio, our server, came out he again checked with me and even told me the marinade used on the meat has soy sauce in it. Since I couldn't eat that he had the chef prepare an unmarinated meat for me and even included fresh avocado in place of the guacamole I couldn't eat (I had the chicken fajita salad and it was delicious). I was so impressed by his knowledge and the fact that he really cared for my dietary concerns. I will definitely come back again. This was one of the best dining experiences I have had since being diagnosed gluten intolerant.

We love this place! I ordered the cheese enchilada plate with a coke and my husband ordered a bean and cheese burrito wet. Shortly after ordering the waiter comes to me and brings a bowl of soup and says my order was on special and it comes with soup for 8.99. GREAT!! The food was fantastic. The right flavors and temperatures. 
We were also given when we sat down chips and a trio of salsa, bean dip and guacamole. Sooooo Yummmy. 
Just have to minor complaints. The restraunt is always warm especially when it is very HOT outside you want to have it cool. Also the are closed Mon and Tues!! I am off on the then and want to go in so it is hard for me to always come cause of my work schedule.
Give this place a try great food and most of the time great staff.

Mexican food has to be so-so because it is in an off strip casino right?  NO!

Since I can remember, I have had Mexican food all over So Cal and enough food in Mexico (away from tourist traps) to say that I was surprised at how good it was.

The service and the place itself is standard.  As far as the food, the flavor and freshness of the ingredients starts with the complimentary appetizers and goes right through all the dishes.  The fish tacos I had were delish, the side dish stuff--beans and rice, were good by themself.  The carnitas was absolutely delish.  Massive portions and with good flavor.  I have had them made in La Puente CA were they were great eventhough they were cooked in lard (lard makes it Hell for those on a diet, but "true" to its Mexican origin, and does a lot for the taste in a good way).  This did not have that deep fried coating--more like it was pressure cooked and tender, but still had the right pan-cooked taste.  It was just good with a nice flavor profile.

For the price, you can't beat it.

Don't get me wrong, the food is great at Baja Miguel's but the service was terrible.  We found a rubber band in our food and instead of apologizing and taking the plate and sending the manager, we sat there for several minutes before the waitress came by and asked if she could clear our table.  We were like, what about the rubber band and she said "oh, that was from the Cilantro", like it happens all the time.  No apology.  The manager finally came by and she took the charge for my meal off the bill.  The waitress came by with our bill, put it down and THEN asked if we would like separate checks.  After we said yes, she acted like she was put out by having to go get our separate checks.  We decided to pay cash to get out of there so we combined the total of the three bills and paid $47 for a $46.45 bill.  She charged back to the table to tell us we didn't pay enough.  We had to show her the totals and that we did give her enough money.  So sad because their food is very good.

Entree came with a Fideo soup! Complimentary chips, guac, beans and salsa! With stay at the hotel here you also get a free margarita with the purchase of an entree, woo! Food was pretty yummy too! My boyfriend had the golden Cadillac and that was super tasty and you could definitely taste the alcohol. I had the house margaritas. The corvette summer was.. Ok. But other than that we are happy with this restaurant. Service is great as well!

This place is pretty good for Vegas Mexican food 

Chips served with guacamole,beans and salsa and it's good 

Both times I ate here the wait staff and food were good  

Happy hour at bar has $3 margaritas and they are on the strong side it was a $6 buzz!

I'll be back

This was the worst Mexican restaurant I have ever been to in my life ..the server was rude and the pork green chili  was dry and hard and beans where awful ,,,salsa was not even salsa ,,This is a place that should be closed down if they dont start making better food and some new servers

Excellent food and service. I come here EVERY time I watch a movie at South Point. I recommend the burrito EL Patron or the tacos carbones. The tortilla soup is fantastic and the fajitas are huge and killer! These people aim to please a d I always have a great experience. Some people complain. They have to wait 10 minutes but that is just a credit to the fact people love their food! I highly recommend as a local.
Meh...cheap drinks but it's clear why. Mediocre food and atmosphere. I probably won't come back

I absolutely love this restaurant! They are conveniently located upstairs in south point casino. 

They have a very nice Mexican atmosphere and the service and food is delicious. We came today to enjoy the lunch special for 9.95 you get a free margarita, a cup of soup, and your choice of the entree. 

I had the tacos, and flautas, they were really tasty and were served with fried beans and rice. My boyfriend had the loaded nachos and he really enjoyed them as well. The margarita was delicious and the service provided by lose was the best! She was such a great treat and was very knowledgeable about the menu! We will definitely come back to see her before we leave Vegas!

Very surprised and pleasantly so! Came in late from the airport and decided to grab a bite and this place was inside our hotel, South Point.

The food was excellent and although the staff was not overly friendly, they were very good and we thoroughly enjoyed the food!

DEPLORABLE!!!!
The official black eye of the South Point Casino.
The service was soooo bad I actually had to bring it to the attention of the Manager/Supervisor  (Amina) 
She was polite, but totally useless and the service did not improve after involving her. She suggested I contact Jason, the manager after the fact...
I explained to her that our waiter Bryan was either over assigned for the evening or lacking training.
That appetizers are to come out before a meal. A 2nd roud of drinks should not take TWENTY-FIVE MINUTES after ordering and a reminder request, to arrive to the table.
The tortillas that should ACCOMPANY fajitas, should not arive 15 meals after the rest of the meal.
I could go on, but I've made my point.
They are doing a lot of things well at this Casino, this restaurant is absolutely, positively NOT one of them.
You've been warned!!!!

Baja Miguel's is one of Las Vegas' best kept secrets.  Located on the second floor of Southpoint casino and hotel, it has always provided fresh, tasty food and very rarely have we had to wait.  

They start with a first class chip and tri-fecta of dips, guacamole, hot bean and medium salsa.  Today I was treated to carnitas and my girlfriend went with the tried and true chile rellano.  Her dish was excellent, as usual.  While I've been pleasantly surprised in the past with the beef and chicken dishes, today's faring was a bit dry, if not tasty.  The pork portions were good sized for the price and the rice and beans were a nice side.  

The service has always been challenging at this venue.  While not necessarily slow, the servers seems to have a chip on their shoulder and almost act bored.  The one standout today was the busboy.  He was quick, efficient, polite and friendly.  I had a flashback that they could have used a bit of Ricardo Montalban in Fantasy Island, when he says, as the plane approaches, "Smile, everyone, Smile!".

Does Baja Miguel's translate to Lower Michael? Odd.  Really the restaurant makes the name, the name rarely makes the restaurant so I'll move on.  Sometimes tangeants are fun sorry not so fun this time.
Loved Baja Miguel's!  We always get off to a good start when the waiter arrives bearing gifts in the form of fresh chips with guac, salsa, and beans at this point I'm confident that we have formed a bond in heaven and earth.
Per usual we tried to overwhelm them with a group of 15 and they accommodated us gracefully and quickly.  
The food was great.  I had shredded beef tacos and a chicken enchilada and both were full of flavor with generous portions.  The 3 entree plate tempted me but the server noticed my slight stature and recommended the 2 entree plate which was a great recommendation because there was plenty of food.
The Grandview (next store) has coupon books that include a free frozen drink with your entree and the kids enjoyed the frozen drinks.
We had 3 kids under 10 and there weren't any selections designed for kids.  The best alternative was a cheese quesadilla.  It came with lettuce and sour cream which freaked out my kid because, "the Sour Cream touched it"  Definitely more of a poor parenting issue than anything but a kids menu would have put the experience over the top. 
If your at the South Point Casino and craving food from south of the border this is a great option.

Let me preface that this review is based on the food and not the customer service.  The customer service was very good!

The food, however, was another story.  One good think I have to say is that the chips and dips you get when are seated are really great!  So that is a plus for them.

I ordered the albondigas soup.  I've had it at many places homemade and restaurant.   Every place seems to follow a basic core recipe:  vegetables, meatballs, and broth.  The soup was luke warm, like it has been sitting from a previous order.  The consistency was like an old marinara sauce and a lot, a lot, a lot of salt to taste.

My girlfriend had a taco and enchilada combination dinner.  Again way to much salt to taste even more than the usual expected amount in this dish.  And you could tell by looking at the refried beans that the dish had been sitting prior for a while.

All in All the food tasted pre-made or pre-cooked or something...

I would say just go to the Del Taco down the block from the hotel...

The food here is great! Especially for the price.. You really can't beat the chips beans and salsa dip. I would have given it a whole 5 stars but the service was lacking. I felt like we were rushed to order and then after ordering the food was dropped off and we weren't assisted AT ALL until we stopped and requested our waiter. I absolutely hate giving bad reviews and I even gave them the benefit of the doubt thinking maybe we went on a bad day. Buuuuut I've been twice and experienced the same thing. 

Summary: food is amazing service is so so. 3 stars because I can sort of see myself going again... Maybe.
I've been coming here for five years now and it has been great every single time. It was better when the Tequila Bar had the $2 special, but still worth the trip.

Poor service. Never sit at the bar to eat!  They ignore you since a waiter has to come over to take your food order. So you then have two bills to pay.  
I ordered the fajitas, which a Mexican restaurant should be able to do. It came out lukewarm, and the chicken wasn't even grilled. It looked like they chopped it up and warmed it and shoved it in  with a bunch of barely cooked peppers and onions.
The bill was thrown at me halfway through dinner.
The bartender went and got my iced tea, and it came back with barely any ice, warm, without a straw in it. Again, plunked down as he walked away disappointed.

This place is great, from the fresh chips, salsa, bean & guacamole dips the frozen Margarita's as my daughter in law would say "They are the bomb". Service is great our waiter & waitress were very  attentive anyone who had a question they knew the answer, didn't need to check with manager. Differently a must if you want great Mexican food. BTW the refried beans are very, very good.

The beans and rice were really tasty. The margaritas were really good. Our waitstaff was attentive. The only issue that I had was that some of the food (guacamole, chili rellenos) needed a bit more taste.

Dined here with my husband while we stayed at the South Point hotel during a recent vacation, and enjoyed our experience, but not so much the food. The dining area offers tables and chairs or booths-it's always nice to have the option. We were seated at a booth and within just a minute or two we had chips, salsa, guac, and beans on our table. I loved the taste of the salsa-not too spicy, but very flavorful. We ordered 2 strawberry margaritas with our coupon from South Point (good for free margaritas), which we found to be just okay. To me it tasted like a margarita mix and I've definitely had better. My husband and I both ordered an entree, which included beans and rice. The portion sizes are pretty generous, but I was a bit disappointed with the taste of my chicken enchiladas, which didn't seem to have any flavor. I enjoyed the rice and beans, but couldn't finish my enchiladas, even when I added sour cream. The service here was great-our waiter was very friendly and attentive, which we appreciated. Great service and fun atmosphere, but taste of food and margs not the best, especially for the price you pay.

It's in the South Point Casino.  That said, you really shouldn't be expecting some grand, authentic Mexican experience.  Baja Miguel's is one of my favorites - and who'd have thunk it?!?

First off, the starting chips & dip...I can't even.  I crave that bean dip at least once every week.  It is so amazing!  The guac & salsa that accompany it are both good as well, but the bean dip is where it's at.  In fact, I would be happy with a couple margaritas and that dip, but I don't know when to say when, so I always overdo it with the dining and end up full and feeling like a stuffed pig.

Which means, of course, I love their entrees.  I usually get seafood enchiladas or the burrito carbon but everything else looks tempting and tasty.  Like I said, I wouldn't call it an "authentic" experience, but it's really, really good.

Not the worst but very much average.   Smallest chili in a chili relleno that I have ever seen.  Server was nice about it and brought another but it was still about the size of a large green bean.

Service was good.  Chips, salsa, guacamole with beans was good.

Others had enchilladas and they were average.

OK if you are staying in the area but I woudn't go out of my way to drive here.

My boyfriend and I ate here last Saturday night, while staying at South Point for the first time. South Point isn't a great hotel, but it sure does off a variety of very inexpensive restaurant options, including Baja Miguel's.

I was generous with my rating, because my boyfriend thought that the Shrimp Diablo dish was the best Mexican food that he has ever eaten. Ever! He definitely wants to come back here. I had a shredded beef taco and cheese enchilada combo. It was good, but nothing extra special. It certainly wasn't something that would make me want to rush back.

They do make great tortilla chips that are very light and salty, served with a dipping trio of salsa, beans and guacamole. Very good.

I have several margaritas at the bar during our trip and they were strong and cheap.

My biggest impression of South Point was the inexpensive food and alcohol. Stay here and feast for pennies. Seriously great values to be had and most of the food was good too. 

The decor looks like something from a cruise ship, especially the bar outside of the restaurant. Garish color scheme and just bad design. The restaurant was also kept ridiculously cold and I spent the meal shivering.

Friendly, lightening fast service.

Large portions, good price and service. Everything I was looking for in a restaurant.  I like there shredded beef tacos, and the salsa is excellent.  There can be a bit of a wait, and they are not open Monday and Tuesdays.

I've had Mexican food before but nothing like this place. First they bring chips and salsa to your table, but not just salsa, guacamole and refried beans for dipping that is out of this world and it's complimentary !  Since we're staying at the resort we get coupons for a free margaritas. Our entrees of chicken enchiladas were delicious!  Our server Octavio was very pleasant and courteous.

If you like Mexican food or any food at all, skip this place. It's that bad. The absolute worst I've ever had. I didn't even eat it and the margarita was horrible too. It said it had muddled jalapeno but came with cut up jalapeno instead. It tasted freezer burnt. The rice was undercooked and tasted like something you get in a pouch for 79¢ at the grocery store. Taco, terrible. Beans, terrible. Guacamole looked and tasted like what is premade in the cold case at the grocery. Even just after a bite of each, my stomach hurt so bad. 
I'll never go again.

We love the " complimentary chips and 3 dips". Food is good but pricey! I really like their Chile Verde Burrito. No children's menu. We paid 20.00 dollars for 2 shrimp and rice tacos, ala carte. There were approx 5-6 bay sized shrimp on a flour tortilla, never again! Nadia was our server. Extremely disappointed in her, she was RUDE and so NOT helpful with finding a reasonable solution for our 6 year old grandsons meal selection, her suggestion was to order and then take the left over back to our room, which, Nadia, did not have a refrigerator! She never came back to check on us so we had to ask another server to assist us. I'm sorry I didn't get this sweet girls name. All Nadia could do is whisper to the gentleman serving beverages and stare at us. I am usually quite forgiving when servers are busy but, such was not the case. She was NOT busy, She was blatantly rude. Moral of this story...decent food, pricey, would return but, request no Nadia or the tall bald beverage server. For what our bill was 80.00 + dollars for 3 dinners (one child, 2 adults) and a beverage each. Because there are functions in the arena that involve youth staying at the hotel and eating out, I recommend a children's menu be available.
Best Mexican food on Las Vegas Blvd . My family  dines here  twice a month. The complimentary chips dips and salsa are great. The service is always quick. Located in The South Point Casino .

I have a dairy allergy, as soon as I ordered my food without any cheese or sour cream, my waitress immediately asked me if I had an allergy. When I confirmed I did she immediately told me that the chips and guacamole had cheese in it and said that she would bring out a new dairy free batch of chips for me. 
I ordered the Taco Salad, which even had cheese in the taco shell, so they replaced that with the allergy-free chips. I have never been more accommodated about my allergy at any restaurant ever. The salad was absolutely delicious and I didn't have to deal with the fear of realizing that there was dairy in it! 

10/10 good fun, lovely atmosphere, incredibly accommodating, and the servers unbelievably friendly!

I went here with my husband one night before bowling and was pleasantly surprised at how good the food was.  Our service was fine - it's not a five star dining establishment but we were well taken care of and the drinks and food arrived in a timely manner.  
The obligatory Mexican restaurant chips and salsa are kicked up quite a few notches with the addition of bean dip and guacamole along with it.  It was all so good and a nice addition to the run of the mill offerings at most joints.  
My husband got steak fajitas and while they were decent, he wasn't particularly impressed.  
I, however, opted for the Frontera Special and they really hit it out of the park!  It was two nicely sized filet mignon that were topped with shrimp and then everything was covered in this sauce that was nothing like I had ever tasted.  They called it a creamy chipotle sauce and it was just perfect paired with the steak and shrimp.  It wasn't overly spicy at all - it was creamy and flavorful and complimented the beef and seafood so well.  
Every entree comes with a cup of fideo soup.  It was decent but I've had far better.
The prices are definitely more than your average Mexican restaurant; tip included, we spent about $50 and we don't drink so that didn't include alcohol.  
The restaurant itself is upstairs so you get the sense that you're away from all the slot machines and smoke.  There are plenty of tables and booths and a central bar located outside the main entrance. 
Baja Miguel's Isn't a place I'd go to regularly on account of the prices and location but it was good and the service was sufficient.

The bean and cheese burrito was moist and extra cheesy and delicious! It tasted like heaven! I have never had a burrito so good! They give you chips and salsa too. The waitress were very nice. I strongly recommend this place.

Very affordable for south of the strip!

I had the Milanesa Cazadores, which was breaded chicken with jumbo skrimpies on top. Delicious and the serving was gargantuan. 

Dude had the Parrillada del Norte, which was pork, steak and grilled chicken. BOMB BOMB BOMB! Serving size was also big.

We were served chips with salsa, guacamole and these wonderful beans! Yum!

Definitely coming back here when I want to get away from the buffets!

This has been the worst restaurant experience I have ever had and that is a true disappointment as we just moved into our new house minutes away and have been really anticipating our first visit. We sat in the bar area, we were told it could be a few minutes which we had no problem with however, when the waitress passes you several times without even greeting you, the bartenders are just looking at you and another waitress is standing behind the hostess stand, there is no excuse! We waited twenty five minutes with no one even greeting us, needless to say we left. We are now at Los Cucos across town where we are enjoying our beverages and waiting on our food..

We have eaten here numerous times. Other than the usual waiters "pushing" you along to get you out quick , we really liked it here ......Unfortunately last night my husband and son had the same steak burrito and both were sick during the night. It was clear they had food poisoning. Both of them . Not pretty !!!! Very disappointed

whenever I see a place like this with outdated signs and seating, I am hesitant. I wasnt sure if his restaurant could serve good food. Despite the restaurant reminding me of the Golden Girls trip to Mexico kind of decor, they actually serve decent food. Nothing is dry or tasteless, which is a huge plus. I doubt the salsa, beans and guac they serve free is made fresh, but its still nice to eat. 

I tried their shredded chicken tacos and they are large, juicy, and flavorful. Two people coukd eat one order.  

Overall, its a fun change from the casino level eats.

For the first time in my entire life, I instructed my party NOT to leave a tip and they reacted by counting out COINS so that we could pay the bill for this would-be meal and ensure that the wait staff was aware that we hadn't forgotten a tip, but simply that they had not earned one from us.

We had a party of four meeting up at this location to grab a quick bite before our movie began at 7:00.  Two of us showed up first and were brought to our seats.  An older gentleman came up to our table and asked for our drink orders...and then a younger gentleman came up a minute later for our drink orders.  I informed him that we had already been helped and thanked him.  After a few minutes, our original server brought out our drinks and a basket of tortilla chips with a tray or salsa, bean dip and guacamole to munch on.  This is one of the things I love about Mexican food restaurants, it's their version of a bread basket and it works so well, for me, because I love salsa and chips.

After about ten more minutes, another of our party showed up and the same thing happened as before.  Older gentlemen gets her drink order and then the younger one does the same thing.  I'm curious, are they really so overstaffed that they need two people to check up on each other or are they just unaware of which sections each is supposed to cover?  No matter, since we were splitting the bill and crunched for time (and our fourth party was stuck in traffic), we order two appetizers to split.  

After we ordered, my best friend noticed that our salsa, bean dip and guacamole was almost empty and the older gentleman was at our table so she asked him to send us a new one.  He looked directly at her as she made the request and then just turned around and walked away.  She gave his retreating back a funny look and then noticed that the younger gentleman was about to pass our table and stopped him for the same request.  He got a very nervous looks on his face, shook his head and informed us that this wasn't his section and he'd send our server over.  Really?  Then why were you asking for our drink orders and serving the two tables to the left and right of us?

The older server came out with his stern face in place and snidely informed my best friend that only the first bowl of salsa and dip is free, afterwards he would have to charge us $7.95.  Just so that everybody is aware, that's the price of an appetizer at this location.  My friend literally laughed at him and waved him away after I had informed him that this would be our once and only visit to this restaurant.  It amazes me that $7.95 is worth the loss of what might have been a repeat customer.

After we ate, the older server handed us our bill of $25.30 and my two companions literally counted out 25 dollars and three dimes while I wrote on the note that they should be on the lookout for my upcoming one star yelp review and that the service was so horrible that I would not be back.  Three servers saw that I was writing on the bill and pointed us out in front of the restaurant while they whispered vehemently about us.  To top everything off, the server came and snatched up what we had left before we were even out of the booth and gave us a cold sneer for our "generosity."  

It's actually a crying shame that I won't be back to this restaurant, especially in a town like Las Vegas where there can't be that many more Mexican food restaurants that would be willing to bestow decent service on a paying customer...right?

Several friends and I went to Baja Miguel's Saturday for Cinco de Mayo. Everyone at our table raved about the food and the huge portions. I had the combo plate consisting of a  beef taco, beef enchilada with sides of Spanish rice and refried beans. Massive amount of food and every bit of it perfectly done.  The Albondigas Soup, which  has always been a favorite of mine is just so-so here so skip it.  
The dishes came out very hot and no one had any complaints whatever. 

Just a word about bean dip that comes out as you're seated:  AWESOME!!  We could have made a meal out of that dip and chips.  There is a guacamole and red salsa along with the bean dip but who noticed??  

 The service here is terrific.  This was my first time here but certainly won't be my last.

OMG! Loved, Loved Loved this place. The service was a bit rough in the beginning however they ended up winning our love. They sang Happy birthday Vegas style to my friend and gave  her free Flan. ALSO they have bomb happy hour. $4 Margaritas and $4 tequila shots.

The food is great, the service is horrid. We've been sitting at the bar for over an hour now. We were offered 1 drink each, and forget about checking back for refills. We waited with empty glasses for around 15min waiting for 1 of the 2 bartenders to notice. Neither did. They were too busy talking to each other and ignoring the patrons sitting at the bar. The bar was not full. Maybe 1/2. What has you so incredibly engrossed in yourselves to the point you're oblivious to your customers needs. 

I finally flagged 1 down after several attempts for a refill
Mark my words, this is possibly the worst restaurant anywhere. Horrible service and horrible food. Factory-made Taco Bell quality with astronomical prices. Not worth your time.

I liked the bar area immediately in front of the restaurant, but we didn't stop there...so here is what I think of the restaurant:

Cozy atmosphere, pretty welcoming. Service is not as good as it could be, basically sub-par. 

I had mango margaritas and there were very good. These in my opinion are 5-star margaritas :) 

The food was pretty good too, better than other places within South Point. I would probably eat there again if I were to stay there. This place really deserves 3.5 stars...

Went for the $9.95 lunch special while staying at SouthPoint. This included a free margarita which was quite large and tortilla chips with a trip of dips. The dips were traditional salsa, a yummy warm bean dip and a delicious guacamole. I was surprised, as I eat Mexican frequently, and have never gotten free guac before.

Lunch started with a Fideo soup. This was nothing special - short, little noodles in a tomato based broth that seemed like a mixture of Cambell's tomato soup with the noodles from their chicken noodle soup. 

Our lunches arrived quickly and were piping hot. We both got a chicken enchilada and a ground beef taco that were accompanied by rice and beans. The food was good and tasted very fresh and exceeded my expectations. 

The dining room is upstairs from the casino, so it was quiet and comfortable. This was a nice change of pace from the endless buffets that are Vegas.

My boyfriend and I paid our bill - I put 7$ in cash and asked to put the rest on the card for a 23$ bill. We get the receipt back to sign and it has charged my boyfriends card the full bill. The guy assumed the 7$ was his tip. Dude your service was good but not 30% gratuity good. Probably the last time I'll be here.
Food is average.....like El Torrito out of the package.  Good service, good drinks...kinda bland other wise.....food is fast to the table and staff is nice.....was hoping for more.....

Went here because my wife and I were craving some Mexican food and some chips with salsa.
It filled that craving we had but the food was just average. 

The service was fine, no complaints there. The food just didn't really hit the spot for us. It might for you if you want to give them a try.

My wife and I are Vegas locals and Mexican food is a favourite. When South Point opened its new Mexican restaurant we had to give it a try, especially as it is only a short drive.

The first thing I noticed about Baja Miguel's is that it looks more like a cafe than a Mexican restaurant. The colours, decor and layout of the tables doesn't make for the most intimate setting.

Before our meal we were given Salsa, bean dip and guacamole. I can't comment on the guac since neither of us like it - The salsa was good but the bean dip was revolting.

I ordered the shredded beef nachos and my wife had cheese enchiladas.  The best way I can describe the food is "Pedestrian" - sort of like what you would expect at a chain restaurant.  The beef on my nachos was a bit sloppy and my wife described her food as "ok, but nothing id ever crave again".

In a city with so many cheap Mexican options, give Baja Miguel's a big miss. The food is OK, but when you have similarly cheap fare all over town, usually of much higher quality, I don't see any reason to go here again.

On the plus-side, drink service was sensational and the staff looked after us well.

Your basic mass produced Mexican food. The waiter's face, Vincente, turned all twisted crazy when I asked for the veggie burrito in corn instead of a flour tortilla. Then oh duh ma'am just get the veggie fajitas with corn instead of flour tortillas. He was so unwittingly rude it was comical. For real, he was clueless. The margaritas were pretty darn good.....that or the fact I've been in "i need a drink" mode since Tuesday night with CES trade show madness and all liquor sounds dreamy.
It was ok food.
Silverware was really clean.

My Mr. and I were absolutely ravenous and decided on Baja Miguel's due to convenience, as it is located in the South Point hotel we stayed at for our trip to attend the 11th ACR Ball. While deciding on our entree, the server brought an awesome spread of complimentary guacamole, bean dip, salsa, and chips. We decided on the sizzling fajita platter, which is more than enough for two. It was divine!  The margarita on the rocks was great too. Our server was awesome! I will definitely return if I stay at the South Point again.

The food was so-so and a little pricey considering, but because it is inside of a hotel we were prepared to pay. The service was fast--I ordered a plate with two tacos and rice/beans, ate one taco, and practically had to fight the waiter to keep him from clearing my (not even half eaten) plate. The margaritas were weak, I had two and felt no effects whatsoever of having an alcoholic beverage, and I usually can't handle more than two drinks.

Kirill's an awesome bartender and his drinks are amazing. Also, their Cevice is the thing to order we couldn't get enough of it. Their happy hour Margaritas and Bloody Maries are the way to go for sure.  Very good Bloody Maries. The restaurant staff, on the other hand, are rude and pushy (especially to make you pay your bill the second you get your food). There's no Happy Hour during Superbowl at the restaurant and bar, they cancelled it. The way we were treated by the restaurant staff is why they get 4 stars, the bartender being great and the good food saving them from 3.

I realize that this is a restaurant in a mediocre off-strip hotel, and maybe I shouldn't have had high expectations, but the food here is actually surprisingly terrible.  My husband and I were staying at South Point and, as semi-vegetarians, decided that going to the Mexican restaurant would be the safest bet for dinner.  Oh no.  No no no.  When we walked in and saw the cheesy Denny's/Olive Garden style decor, we should have turned around and walked right back out.

There are no drink prices on the menu, nor is there a drink menu.  When we asked how much a Corona was, we were given a range of 'between $4-6'.  Huh?  Are we bartering here?  They then brought out the chips and dips.  Of the three, the salsa is terrible, the guac is meh and the bean dip was just okay.  We ordered the ceviche and received a bland, waterlogged dish of previously frozen fish.  Yum.  Eventually we received our main meals, and I was soooooo happy I went with the safe cheese enchiladas.  It wasn't memorable by any means, but it was 1000 times better than what my husband got.  He ordered a veggie burrito.  It is really hard to screw up a veggie burrito, and even a bad veggie burrito is usually still edible.  This thing though ... looked okay on the outside, but when my husband cut in to it he discovered that his burrito was comprised of three things: steamed carrots, cauliflower and broccoli.  Nothing else.   You may have purchased a similar vegetable blend in a bag from the frozen section of your grocery store.  Steamed carrots, cauliflower and broccoli are not burrito ingredients, not even a little bit.  No amount of hot sauce could save this burrito, we just spent the rest of the meal looking at it and cracking up.

When staying at South Point, save your money and order a pizza or take the time and drive to a decent restaurant elsewhere.  I cannot believe we actually paid money for a steamed cauliflower burrito.

This is my third time staying at the South Point, but my first time eating at Baja Miguel's.  I was here with my family (wife and two kids), and the food was decent...except for my daughter's Taco Salad "with Chicken."  It was ice cold and there was no chicken.  It was so bad that I asked for it to be removed from our bill, and said we would order dessert to make up for that.  The waiter never removed it from my bill, said he couldn't do it, and had to ask the manager.

The manager was perhaps the WORST manager I've ever dealt with.  She acknowledged the issues with the food but said she would only take half off.  I went back and and forth with her politely, and she only refunded the entire amount after the waiter voluntarily went back to her AGAIN.  I literally saw her walk by our table SHAKING HER HEAD.  I guess "how dare a guest not like the food" was something she never dealt with before.

This experience soured me enough to never go back to this restaurant, and I'm not sure I'll stay at the South Point again.

If you don't have issues with your food, it's okay.  If you do, don't expect to be treated fairly.

Very nice ambiance, not too loud. Great attentive servers and away from the casino. 

Food was prepped very well and the portions are great. The overall menu has a lot to choose from and won't disappoint. Great for families and kids!

Don't order the seafood salad if your hungry. It's just a few shrimp and scallops on lettuce and tomato for $13.95. My wife said the chicken tacos were the best she's ever had. Not the best Mexican restaurant but we live the SouthPoint. Had their huge burrito tonight with char broiled steak. Very good.

(3.5 star)
Came here for dinner on Thursday. 
The hostess, Lucy that sat us in a booth was very friendly.
The complimentary chips were nice and hot. Came with, salsa, bean dip and guacamole. Wasn't bad at all!!
I ordered Frontera Special. I wasn't expecting the food to be great because of 3 star on Yelp and a lot of people had bad experience here. Actually, my steak was very tender and lean. The red sauce that came with it was so good. (salty but good)
Only thing was the shrimp fajita wasn't sizzling and smoking like the other Mexican restaurants'. 
We were hungry and wanted our food ASAP so we appreciate the fast service they gave us. Food came out pretty fast!
I didn't have it but I heard their margarita is good :-)

Being a local here, this place is not too bad. Prices are reasonable and portions are great. As other reviewers have said, the chile relleno was much like an eggy pancake with a small chile inside that was not stuffed with cheese. Was not good at all. But the rest of our meal was great and filing, the complimentary chips with salsa, bean dip & guac was tasty. And a refill for the dips is not $7-8 as another reviewer complained, it's only $2. The margarita needs some improvement, add a lil tequlia to it. The servers were quick, attentive and kept our drinks filled.  We will definitely be back

Here's the Scoop: My husband and I had a beautiful anniversary lunch here. Hot chips and salsa was served while we waited for our order. The ambiance is cozy and colorful. The service quick and the food delicious nice portions. We enjoyed our time here and the manager gave us a Anniversary card signed by all of the staff that was wonderful. The food was seasoned well and waiters constantly checked on you but were not overbearing. Check them out they're located on the second floor of the Casino.

We are staying nearby at the Grandview which generously gives you tons of coupons for discounts at South Point including free margaritas at Baja Miguel's. We naturally took a walk over to Baja Miguel's to take advantage of the offer. The service was great, attentive but not pushy. We were greeted and seated by a hostess. She brought waters for the table. Then the server arrived, welcomed us brought fresh, warm chips and a trio of warm refried beans, salsa and guacamole. You had me at chips, salsa and guacamole, beans too... yes! I asked for the spicy salsa. He brought out a delicious fire roasted salsa that went so well with the spinach and mushroom enchiladas topped with guacamole and sour cream. The food was good, cheesy enchiladas, rice and beans and the salsa made it for me. My friends enjoyed their dishes and we all left satisfied. I took away leftovers that made for a tasty breakfast the next morning. Back to the free margies, I had a margarita salt on the rocks, my friends ordered blended, raspberry and mango. The blended is the better option here unless you upgrade from the house margarita (mine tasted like pure margarita mix). But hey it was free so I'm not complaining. This is my second year staying at the Grandview off strip and affordable for CES. I'd return to Baja Miguel's next year.

Wow...I mean...wow.

4 of us sat down at a booth, as the guy brings the chips and salsa I requested an extra salsa so we didn't need to reach. He responds by saying only one is complimentary....Are kidding me? 

We all order our meals and then we noticed the lunch special which tossed in a margarita and some fideo soup and were bummed we didn't see it sooner. The server comes out with our soup and margaritas and says she ran em through as the special to take care of..kudos to young lady.

The soup was a the typical cheapo tomato juiced wannabe soup. Wasn't horrible, just not special. I think it is sold in 50 gallon barrels as I swear I have experienced that before several times.

The margarita, was a limeade slushy. Absolutely 0 tequila.

When the food came out we had everything from shredded chicken tacos, to Diablo seafood, to chile relleno.

The Relleno was like a soggy egg pancake, the chicken was as bland as could be. I mean, even if you cook chicken plain it has more flavor than that. The scallops of the seafood diablo were chewy and fishy so I am guessing frozen, then thawed too early, then served.

This food was redic. Do not go here. 

On a positive note, the server was awesome and was still tipped very well.

Baja Miguel's reminds me of Don Miguel's restaurant in the Orlean's hotel. (anything catchy in the names ???) 
In fact, the entire Southpoint Hotel reminds me of the Orlean's - just newer.  
Both Hotels the same room layouts which are really quite large and nice. And .... they have exactly the same type Mexican restaurant. 
I really like the service at Baja Miquels much better and they do have quite a display of Margaritas. The food is very good. They will bring you as many bowls of chips and salsa as you can handle.
The Margaritas are quite tasty.
If you stay at the hotel there are a couple of coupons that make your dining stay a bit lighter in the wallet, however the prices are very resonable for the portion size.
A very nice, very average Mexican restaurant.
Great place for Mexican food love the chicken and steak fajitas. Only wish they were open all week .

Margaritas at the bar were great, And only 3$ at happy hour! They also bring you chips with salsa beans and guacamole for FREE which is awesome! We then went into the restaurant for dinner, it was pretty good, I had the chicken enchiladas, and my bf had tacos. Both tasted good, my only concerns was that after we ordered, we font out food like 2 minutes later, which led me to believe that the food isn't super fresh, still tasted pretty good though.

Horrid! Worst Mexican food ever!! Don't order the fish tacos or chicken burritos! 
Soup was nasty too! 
Don't waist time here!!
Loved the free tortilla chips and they give you a trio of dips....salsa, guacamole & refried beans. Food was good too

I kept hearing about this place and we finally found a time to make our way there. the casino gave us a comp for the restaurant which was really nice.

the hostess was a sweetheart and very lively as she greeted us upon our arrival. it was pretty busy but our wait wasn't too long before we were sat. I liked the chips and dips - salsa lacked a little flavor but adding a little salt and lime helped give it a kick. 

I went with the shrimp diavolo, chose the soup as a side option and it was so delicious! it was nice how they gave a good chunk of avocado too instead of cutting you short with just a slice or two. 

we saw our busser more than we did our server but he was pretty awesome. overall good experience :)

We had a great experience at Baja Miguel's. Went for lunch and we were promptly greeted by a very nice hostess. Got our table and were quickly given chips, guacamole, salsa, and bean dip. All very tasty!! We got the daily special and food was excellent. Waitress was friendly and prompt. Great experience!! Definitely will be back

Food was decent, not terrible but nothing to rave about. The frozen margaritas were less than thrilling... way too much salt and definitely not enough alcohol. The service was awful. Incredibly slow waitstaff, I actually received my margarita after I received my entree..... The best part is the chips that are served with salsa, guacamole, and a bean dip.

Went here strictly because of the DEFTAL tequila session event. Nice event! They had a strolling Mariachi band, a DJ, 5 different types of tequila's, 4 types of beers and a snack station. Chips w/ salsa, guac and quesadilla. Oh did I mention it was a 7 - 10 pm event that was completely free!

How cool it was however I only stayed about an hour not a big drinker and being new to town no friends to take or meet me there so I was in saw it had a 3 shots and a beer...Don Julio reposado, one from Jilsco owned by George Clooney, Patron Anejo and Negra Modela and went home. 

It was a very nice event!

I wouldn't rave about this place but we like it and have been back quite a few times.  Some very good dishes and we have always had good service.  If you are spending time at South Point, I would say choose this place over some of the others on the property.

The lunch special is a fantastic deal! Wednesday through Sunday from 11am-5pm they have a deal for $9.95 that includes a frozen Margarita, Fideo soup, and your choice of two items from: beef, chicken, or cheese enchilada; chicken, ground or shredded beef taco; chicken or beef flautas; chili relleno. The free chips served as an appetizer were yummy too and included beans, salsa, and guac. Coming back for the daily special in the future!

So my boyfriend and I were originally trying to eat at the prime rib place located right next to Baja Miguel's but they were closed so we decided to give them a try. And thank good we did. We were there for a bowling tournament and hadn't eating all day. This place is very hospitable. Like as if you were going over to your grandmas to eat. 

The food was amazing. Authentic Mexican food. Delicious and homemade. My boyfriend and I couldn't get over how good it was. 

The staff was very attentive and stayed in task. Very helpful and catered to our every need. 
Definitely will be going back next trip to Vegas 

I had the chile rellano with and enchilada and my boyfriend had steak picado with a taco. So good we were picking at each other's good that hoe food it was. Let's not mention the chips and guacamole and the ever to tasty margaritas.

For sure a hidden gem at the south point hotel and Casino.

Do yourself a favor and DO NOT EAT HERE! Food was not up to par and even a couple days old. Everything tasted like it was out of the can and the margarita was all sweet and sour. Do your self a favor and don't go to Baja Miguel's. We both got sick :(
Good food excellent service. Very helpful with our allergy issues. With coupon book we got free margaritas with our entrees.

baja miguels in southpoint hotel casino is one of las vegas best mexican restaurants the prices are cheap and the food is plenty the chips and dips are a delight always hot and fresh there food is always spot on try baja miguels you taste buds will thank you

Had dinner here last night. The service was decent, our waiter was very helpful and refilled our drinks as was necessary. They were very accommodating with our children, we needed two high chairs, we were a party of six. Not a problem there.

The food is mediocre, nothing spectacular. I had the enchiladas suizas, which were tasty but nothing spectacular. My daughter ordered the beef tamales which were mostly masa and not enough beef. My husband had the carne asada burrito but wasn't excited about it. The one thing I did enjoy was the Taquitos appetizer, the shredded beef was delicious and the taquitos were not overcooked. Crunchy not soft. Another thing I enjoyed was that they give you chips with not only salsa but also beans and guacamole for starters so bam right there you already have nachos!!

One disappointment was their drinks selection, we asked if they had any horchata, tamarindo, etc and they don't. Our nice waiter even explained we weren't the first to ask about those drinks, maybe it's something they can look into, I mean come on, even Am Pm offers them. 

Prices are basic but you do get big servings. If you're craving basic Mexican then this is a good place for you. If you want authentic don't waste your time. Oh and no kids menu :(
Giving this 5 stars for the lunch special alone.   My favorite on every trip to LV. Great food at a great price. Wish they were open Mon and Tue.

I would have given this place my first one star rating if it wasn't for the free lime Margarita with salt (free with lunch special) - It's making my mouth water just thinking about it... 
1st star- It's free / 2nd star- It's lime with salt around the rim =2 stars!!!
The first clue to me as to if a Mexican restaurant will be good or not is if the tortilla chips and flour tortillas are good, I mean if a Mexican restaurant can't get these 2 regular items correct then I know the rest of the food will most likely not taste good and as always I was right...
There is not much taste in any dish that I have tried there(because of my parents I have eaten there a few times). The last thing I tried was Pollo Baldastano ( Chicken breast stuffed with ham & cheese then ovenbaked with a pepper sauce) - Sounds hellah good huh? Well it tasted like cafeteria food... Don't expect too much from this place - 
I don't...

All the times I have been to SouthPoint and never knew about this little gem right here.  Baja Miguel's is located directly upstairs from Don Vito's.  Great mexican food, family friendly environment, clean restaurant and nice staff...and SUPER FAST SERVICE

I'm all about food, and I live in a state where some of the best eateries can be found.  Surprising note, you always find them in the most LOW-KEY places.  For me, Baja Miguel's is one the these places...diamond in the rough.

Chips and the TRIO (beans, guac, salsa) was placed in front of us 5mins into be seated.  As the same time that the young lady delivered chips she also introduced herself and took our drink orders.  Maybe another 5mins and we were sipping on our drink.  The server came and took our order, I order the Pork Tamales with red sauce served with rice and beans.
