10-15mins hot plate of food in my face, yep I was a very happy fat girl.  The portions are decent, if I wasn't being greedy that could have easily fed 2.  My favorite part of tamales is the maza, the texture has to be right.  Not too creamy and not crumble where it just break apart in rough pieces.  You fork should just slice into the tamale with no effort, and that's EXACTLY how these tamales were.  But let's not stop there, because if the meat is not season and/nor cooked right then the entire dish is ruin.  Um yea, and dousing red sauce doesn't help.  However, this is NOT the case here, the pork was seasoned well and tender. The sauce made it perfect, not too MUCH, just enough.  You can taste all the layers without them overpowering each other.  

The PERFECT BITE, load your fork with a little tamale, bean, rice and sauce (don't overload your fork, enough to get everything in one bite) Stack your fork and it's FOODIE bliss, add some crunch with a chip and take a sip of you drink. I don't know, mexican food is totally elevated to a different level when it is paired with a TEQUILLA base beverage, but that;s just me.  

$25 including tip, yes I will be back...but this is just my opinion, go check them out and see for yourself

We ate lunch here yesterday.  I ordered a seafood salad and my husband ordered the daily special.  His was ok, mine not so good.  The salad said grilled shrimp and scallops and that is basically all you get over a plain bed of chopped head lettuce period!  Nothing else except a couple of fried cheese things, but absolutely nothing else.  Not even a tomato, avocado, or anything else.  Dressing was bland and tasteless.  What a waste of $15.95!  I was expecting something with more appeal than this for the price they charged!  Will not return here.

The food was much better than I had expected given its a hotel restaurant.  The bean dip is good and I ordered the chimichanga which was also pretty good.  The only negative was the service.  The waiter was pretty short and rude.

The free hot chips, and condiments, they bring out in the begning of the meal is very good. I had the Shrimp Fajita as my entree....it was average at best (it really lacked seasoning). My dinning partner had the beef burrito, and she loved it. Service was good, but not thrilled with the fact that you can not order food to go. Southpoint Casino occasionally sends me comps for this resturuant, so I am sure I will eat there again....but if I had to pay for the meal, then I would prefer to eat somewhere else.
Nice service, great chips ,salsa  glaucoma, bean dip.  Food not so  good. Maybe an off day. We will try again.

Great lunch special our family of four was easily able to share! Left stuffed and was able to take the kids bowling. Trio of dips is awesome. Service was great (Alejandro) he was attentive and personable. Perfect place when station at the Grandview or Silver Point.

I was staying at the South Point and love Mexican food so based on reviews selected this place.  Everything about it was horrible.  The decor is cheesy diner/cafe style; there is no ambiance whatsoever.  The elderly male host was almost single handedly the most rude restaurant employee I've ever encountered.  The salsa was ok however the food in general was bland and the margaritas were watered down.  Complete waste of money and time.

My mom received comp coupons in the mail. After confirming with the waiter that the coupon would be accepted, when it was time to close out the bill the manager said the waiter misspoke because the coupon didn't have her name on it. Then they called SIX security guards on my 65 year-old mom- one the most zenned out people in the world.

I had to DRIVE there and explain that I had also received the coupons. Instead of admitting the waiter was wrong and honoring what the STAFF told her, they humiliated a great-grandmother who was just trying to enjoy lunch.

The only thing I enjoyed was the bean dip!   It was the bomb!   But everything else was like heating up a frozen dinner.  I had the enchilada suiza, my daughter had the flautas and both were not worth eating a quarter of the meal.  Smh

First, guacamole should not be neon green. It is obvious from the taste and look that the guacamole is a low quality guacamole filled with preservatives to keep it that bright color. Might be the worse guacamole I've ever had.

Second, the Spanish/Mexican rice needs some help. Traditional Spanish/Mexican rice doesn't have peas in it. It looks like they share the rice with the Chinese menu from the downstairs cafe and just add some tomato paste to it.
Food is decent, but service was poor. Good chips. Waiter served men first and never checked back to see how the food was. Chips not refilled and we ran out of water. Just poor attention to detail.

The margariitas are good! However the food is lousy! I ordered tacos cabron, it came with rice that did not taste good and beans which were completely unedible, the taco itself was just OK. This restuarant has absoultly ZERO ambuiance, service is just average, and never saw the hostess (an older lady) smile once.

Had dinner with my mom & kids & we had a great time! No wait to be seated, the hostess & server was on point. They made us feel very comfortable and at home.

I ordered the Camarones Mazatlan (shrimp in a garlic butter sauce over Mexican rice), a margarita, the ceviche & a quesadilla for the kid. My mom got the 3 item Combinados Platos and the portions are HUGE so you can definitely share.

All in all the service and experience was great! But I'm sad because I left my ceviche in the to go box so I couldn't finish all the goodness ahaha
Not good! Waiter was rude. Salsa was tasted like canned tomatoes with little flavor. Margaritas were super watered down. Guac was disgusting. Food was barely eatable.

Was at the southpoint this afternoon and thought we try something different beside steak and shake. Me and my boyfriend had he $7.95 lunch specials. First off you get chips, salsa, beans, and guacamole to start off with for free and the guacamole was delicious!! Most Mexican restaurants always charge for guacamole so I was shocked it was free. I had the carne la plancha with beans and rice and it wasn't that good. The meat looked and had the texture of cat food. My boyfriend had the flautas and he really enjoyed them. Next time I come back I will probably go with my gut like I should have this visit and order the fish tacos. Oh and the raspberry margarita was amazing!!

First off, this is not a gourmet or fancy  Mexican restaurant. But does offer great value, good food, a varied menu,  and very friendly service in a pleasant setting.. I have been coming here since it opened. And while it's not my favorite Mexican place to go ( I have lived here for over 18 years)....it still an enjoyable experience. Great after a movie....Perfect for lunch....
They always have room because of how large it is.   Try it....:-)

I love Baja Miguel's for lunch.  They have a lunch special for $8.95, which consists of two items, beans and rice, fideo soup, and a margarita (or substitute drink).  Since I am usually here during my work lunch break, I get a virgin margarita, which is still delicious.  They also bring out chips and dip pretty much as soon as you sit down.

Food was great. I am new to Vegas and been to a few Mexican joints that were not good. This place had really good food. Chips, salsa, guach, bean dip to start. I had 2 enchiladas, chicken and cheese, and a chicken Taco. Too much food, but can't wait for my left overs at home. Ambiance needs help. If you didn't know the food was good you would swear it wasn't by looking at the yellow walls and wacky carpet. Will definately go back.

We ordered the $8.95 luncheon special that includes a margarita, fideo soup and a 2-item combination.  We went with a traditional margarita on the rocks and chile relleno/enchilada for our combo.  The margarita and soup were good, but Miguel's interpretation of Tex-Mex was pretty typical (e.g. mediocre) for a casino eatery.

I read a number of really negative Yelp reviews and almost passed on this place. Something told me to ignore them. While it's unfortunate so many folks had bad experiences here, I'm pleased to say my family and I did not. In fact, we really liked the place (and we're obnoxious, New York food snobs - and proud of it dammit!)

I had the vegetable burrito without the cheese. My son had a chicken fajita and my wife had an enchilada and a strawberry margarita. We loved them! 

I noticed they put sour cream in the guacamole. I've never seen that before, but perhaps it's a regional thing. 

Our server was very kind, thoughtful and competent. The fellow that bussed the table and refilled our water glasses was respectful and unobtrusive.

Who knows? Maybe management took all the negative reviews to heart and made some positive changes. For us, this was a very positive experience and we'll certainly come back.

We've been coming here now for over 5 years. Good food, fast service, and friendly staff.  You'll enjoy this Mexican restaurant that's upstairs in the South Point Casino.  

Just outside of the restaurant you can get the happy hour menu from Baja Miguel's.   Great deals and good staff.  We will continue to come back again and again.
Loved it. Friendly staff and good food. They bent over backwards to address my gluten allergy, and were very knowledgable. I'd definitely return.

Dinner tonight. Margaritas were excellent. Service was very good and food was very good. My buddy asked for something not on the menu due to his dietary requirements  and they were very accommodating.  No complaints.  Next time we are at south point, we will return.
Great food and great service. Reasonably priced, with huge portions. I ordered the El patron Burrito. It was awesome. I ordered with fajitas chicken with no extra charge. Highly recommend.

Having a family meal. We are a table for 10 and made reservations. Table was ready upon arrival. Service was fast and friendly. Food was awesome!
I love this place and come here a few times a year. Whenever my folks come to visit they stay at the Grandview timeshare which is adjacent to the Southpoint Casino. Which makes this the perfect place to eat.
Food is always excellent!

We had lunch here before leaving, the Guac, salsa and bean dip were great with the tortilla chips that were set out for the table and since there were 5 of us they brought out 2.  I ordered a lunch special fro $10 which was my choice of 2 items served with rice and beans. Didnt realize that this came with a bowl of soup, this soup basically tasted like spaghetti O's except instead of round noodles they were 1 inch short skinny noodles, so if you like spaghetti O's this ok.  I ordered a chicken and a cheese enchilada. The Chicken was quite good but the cheese was not, already congealed and hard. I had also ordered a side of sour cream and like other posters this never happened. our server did not come back and no one else would make I contact as they swirled around the restaurant, they do have a lot of staff which makes you think that the service should be better than it was. All in all i would eat here again and im sure i will next year as my friends love it.

Baja's never disappoints.  Very hot food made to order.  Friendly service. Great chips/salsa/guac/bean dip.  Awesome churros.  We've tried almost everything over the years and it's all been amazing.  Friday/Saturday nights have a wait but just sit at the bar and enjoy a drink.

We came here because our hotel coupon books offered a free margarita with an entree. The food is mediocre and the margarita had no alcohol, but the service was great! There was no wait to be seated, which was nice and there was complimentary salsa, bean dip and guacamole. I rated this so low mainly because of the quality of food. That being said, I think the prices are a little high for the product. But hey, it's Vegas.

Decent casino mexican food - full disclosure: they gave me a free margarita with my lunches. Do not go during peak times if you value your gambling time at all. I went here for lunch on a few occasions and the service is unreasonable slow and inattentive. If you are going to make your customers wait, then make sure their glasses are full.

Standard mexican food, but the rice and beans tasted pre-prepared. Everything else was good for the price I paid - less than $10

We had a family dinner here. The service was horrible. The waiter kept letting drinks go dry and would miss when we would reorder cocktails...FAIL!. The food was mediocre at best. Pretty bland. The space felt so temporary. I was just disappointed in this place all around. the only good thing was the chips and salsa came with guacamole and the bean dip was pretty tasty. Downside...a few of the group members got a little ill after eating here. 

The prices were a little high for what you got.

Have been here 3 times in the past 3 months. Food and service has been very great each time. There are not many good Mexican sit down restaurants in this area. There are a few things strange. You can't order a one item combo, no ala carte, also they don't have dinner salads. They do have great chips, Guac and bean dip. Margaritas are good there too. Have gone for lunch and they were closed so check lunch hours before you go. Dinner can be busy after 630 or so.

We walked up and got a sub standard greeting, but we were seat immediately, in the back. The waiter greeted us in a timely fashion, and asked us what we would like to drink. I asked if there was happy hour and he said no. Which I thought it was odd since it was 6PM on a Friday night. I guess the bar out front has the happy hour and not the restaurant. My wife asked for a mojito and he said we don't have mojitos then he recanted his statement. He stated he will check in the back. Moments later he came back to the table and said we only have mint for two mojito. We ordered two and he said that's all the mint we have. We said ok and he brought the drinks full of mint. We ordered chicken fajitas and a steak dish. It was delivered within 15 minutes. The only acknowledgment we got from the waiter was to ask if we wanted dessert. The food was tasty but over priced. Most likely we will not be visiting this restaurant in the near or distance future.

I have to be honest, I've been there a few times and the food is not my favorite. I've had the  tacos, enchiladas,   chili Riano, rice/beans. I've had better I'm sorry to say. The salsa you can tell is made with can tomatoes and seasoned on top. The margaritas, I think they forgot the tequila, you are drinking straight sweet m sour. (This is a error in the bartender only) get the Fugio only. Miguel our waiter is FABULOUS, that's the only reason we come back!! He is super, friendly and always try's to make it right. I feel if the food was a bit better, that would be great

Ate here while staying at the South Point.  Well, at least it was priced reasonable.  Other than that it was nothing to write home about...at all!  The service was very poor (slow and kind of rude).  The food was not really good at all.  It didn't make us sick or anything, and it did fill us, but it just wasn't good.  But hey, when you are stuck at the casino, what are you going to do?

This place is ok, its better than most of the other Southpoint restaurants. I'd go there again but I wouldn't be all excited over it either. The food and service is ok, acceptable to good. Never excellent in our experience. Typical Mexican fare, nothing to go out of your way for.  I heard some items do not have free refills or are too expensive so please ask all questions before ordering and do not assume anything. The lunch special is worth it, dinner isn't worth the extra cash you'll be paying.

I was really excited about the happy hour at the bar just outside the restaurant. So after hitting the sauce for awhile. We decided we should probably eat something. It is definitely not my favorite Mexican restaurant. But it was far from the worst too. Service and food was quick and friendly. And I am sure if I am in the mood for Mexican? And don't want to leave the hotel I will eat here again.

Nice open seating and very attentive staff ( we were there early when they opened and the traffic was light). Nice menu choices and standard pricing on most items. Food was served timely and the Fajitas (shrimp) was too hot to eat which is how it should be served.
Our first time there but probbaly not our last.
This place has great mexican food, as well as steak, chicken and believe it or not, fantastic chicken fettucini.  i am a mexican food junkie, and this is one of the best.

Great food. Great service. Lose served us and was great. One of the restaurants at the hotel without smoke from the casino. Yay!!!

Love Mexican food as long as it's not spicy with peppers. I know, it's an oxymoron  What can I say?  But they prepared my food just the way I like it. 

Even the manger stopped by our table to check on our large group. They gave us separate checks without a problem. All the staff was friendly and patient with us.

Food was OK but the service was horrible.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.  I'm a very patient person and give wait staff a lot of room cause I know it's a hard job dealing will so many types of people but could not get a refill on our drinks the entire meal.  Our drinks had long been gone by the time the food arrived.  Our waiter walked past us several times and completely ignored our attempts to get his attention.  He did finally come over and we managed to get the check.   I told the hostess and a gentleman man how bad the service was. The apologized and said the would speak with the waiter which makes me think he was a manager.  

I wouldn't recommend. Just my humble opinion.

My husband and I live up the street & regularly go to South Point Casino for movies, bowling, or to eat. I told him I wanted to try Baja Miguel's so we went to eat there last night around 6:30pm. I was surprised there wasn't a wait for a table. We were quickly seated, greeted by our server, and our order taken. We were given chips with salsa, guacamole, and beans as an appetizer. The rest of the restaurant filled up within 30 minutes. I got the choice of 2 combination entree: I chose a chicken enchilada and a beef taco, it came with rice and beans. While the service was great, the food was less than mediocre. The taco tasted EXACTLY like a beef taco from Taco Bell, and the enchilada tasted like a microwaved frozen enchilada. I would expect more for a $14.95 plate. We probably won't be coming back to eat here. I'll stick to Coronado Cafe after midnight for the $4.95 steak breakfast special.

**Summary**
       - Lunch Special - They have a lunch special for $8.95 Wednesday through Sunday. It's a really good deal and includes a drink (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Oto60yDwk1z72WmfWEYrjg?select=1m4c2eotnlfsD3whZLohoA).
       - Chips and Dips - You're given a chips with beans, salsa, and guacamole (all house made) when you're seated. You can see the chunks of avocado in the guac. It's delicious (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Oto60yDwk1z72WmfWEYrjg?select=qP5qEupOH8WAHq0wXYHgdw).
       - Fideo soup - You receive fideo soup with almost every order. It's a salty tomato based soup with angel hair pasta in it (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Oto60yDwk1z72WmfWEYrjg?select=c_Fo6l5F1uAeLg0MWAWbDQ).
**Ordered**
       - $14.95 Rib-eye Skillet - The steak was juicy but had a tomato flavor that I didn't believe steak should have (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Oto60yDwk1z72WmfWEYrjg?select=w3lbn27Wn_UTSDAlGJiRQw).
       - $12.95 Carne Asada - Skirt steak was a bit thin. It had a charcoal flavor that was pretty tasty (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Oto60yDwk1z72WmfWEYrjg?select=th7JTCiLmeIyUF9F9oxgQg).
**Recommendations**
       - The chips and dip you get at the beginning of your meal is half the reason I go here. I don't care too much for the soup and the Mexican food is decent.

Service was great,  they kept the drinks full and were very friendly. 

Food itself was just blah,  salsa tasted like something from a bottle (Pace...) and the guac was nothing special.

I know places do Spanish Rice in different ways but leave the carrots and peas out! 

Overall bland flavors likely made to please the masses.

Not bad, not outstanding. If I was staying there I'd eat there again. I wouldn't drive far to sample the place. But if you're close it will do!

Decor is really cheesy, like I'm on a cruise ship cheesy.
Just ok. Nothing outstanding. I had enchiladas and the sauce was probably Old El Paso. The chips and salsa, guacamole and beans were fine. Service was good. Food was ordinary.

I am actually very surprised at all the not so great reviews of this place, I know that initial reaction is, " Oh Raymond, you must not know good Mexican when it slaps you in the face." My response is this, " the food can't be good if its slapping you in the face and I really do know me some Mexican food. This was one of those places that we pass all the time when walking to the movie theater or the players club and have not given it a second thought. One Sunday we were on our way home from our church that is on Dean Martin and my wife was craving Mexican food so I decided we should hit the one in the southpoint.

We walked into the southpoint and headed to our buddy Miguels, The lady at the door/counter seated us and off we went. One of the servers brought us the starters, I obviously expected chips and salsa but instead we received Chips, Salsa, Guacamole and bean dip, Whoa hold the train here, " Um, I did not order this" I know sir it comes with the meal.. Yes, Miguel scored. we then cracked open the menu and see the amazing combo, $8.95 for two items, Fideo, beans, rice and a Drink, yes this means alcoholic drink and we are not talking bills gambling hall .99 margaritas these are adult sized. 

The food came out and everything on my plate was awesome, from the beans to the taquitos, it was all hot and fresh and tasted as authentic as you could expect at a casino Mexican joint. If it was in my kitchen that would be a different story. But for $8.95 you just cant beat it.  The service was great, the food was great and it definitely makes you want to return.

Baja Miguel's was a nice surprise!  Hidden away on the second floor inside South point Casino, Baja Miguels is a good choice for a nice Mexican lunch or dinner.  When they bring out the chips, they come with a combination of salsa, guacamole, and sour cream.  They have some great lunch time specials which include soup, an entree, and a Margarita.  The food was great and the prices were very reasonable.  The atmosphere was OK.  The service was above average.  Overall, 4.25 stars.

Good food great daily special came with margarita soup chips dips choice of 2 items we did flautas and enchiladas  rice and beans with sour cream we were defiantly happy and full nice atmosphere food came out fast which was great because we were heading to see a movie after

I love this place! Every time I am at the South Point I make sure I go.  Everything I've tried is delicious. You can't beat their lunch special.  Two items w/ rice & beans, soup, chips,  salsa,  guac,  bean dip,  Margarita all for $9.95.
Great lunch special. Service and food were quite excellent. Lunch special comes with Margarita or soft drink and guacamole is served with the chips at no additional cost.

I will be nice and give them 3 stars because their "lunch" special is a pretty darn good deal.

This place is located within the South Point Hotel, upstairs next to Primarily Prime Rib. The decor is nothing spectacular.  I was there before my bowling league around 4:45 on a Sunday night and it wasn't crowded at all.  The host was friendly and we were seated immediately.

A Server was quick to bring us chips/salsa/bean dip and guacamole and take our drink order.  The salsa was not very good - I like my salsa hot, and this tasted like it was out of bottle (think Pace Picante Sauce).  The bean dip was pretty good, and I was surprised to see the small scoop of guac along with the chips.  It was only OK.

Well, I noticed that they have a lunch special, which happens to go until 5pm (we were just under the wire)...It was $9.95 for a 2 item combo (you get to choose the 2 items), rice/beans (of course), fideo soup and a margarita or soda. I don't drink tequila, so I got a virgin margarita and my friend got a marg on the rocks. She had already ordered a soda, but didn't know that the marg would be included with her meal, and the server ended up not charging us for her soda, which I thought was nice.

I got the combo with a cheese enchilada and chile relleno and my friend got a beef taco and a cheese enchilada.  My enchilada was super cheesy and good, but it is pretty hard to screw them up, especially in a place called Baja Miguel's.  My chile relleno was one of the strangest I've EVER had. And I've eaten a lot of Mexican food in my day.  I am not saying it was bad, it was just different.  And different was not necessarily what I was looking for when I ordered that item.  Instead of being a chile stuffed with cheese, breaded and fried, it was more like an egg/chile casserole.  It was just strange. And not spicy at all.  The beans and rice were pretty typical, nothing exciting there.  The fideo soup was pretty decent.  I actually liked it better than the soup they served at Lindo Michoacan (which isn't really saying too much).

The service was super friendly and fast and we were in and out of there pretty quickly.  I would go back, and I would probably order the combo again, but I would try something different.

I didn't really have high expectations when we went it, and I ended up pretty happy, so I can't complain.

Excellent and I am picky.  First and fore most their beef enchiladas are made with shredded beef, NOT taco meet.  5 stars for that!!!!  Ground beef tacos very large and not skimpy on the meat.  I really like the presentation as well.  Chips and salsa is free and also comes with guacamole and refried beans.  5+ stars for that as well.  Service was also fast and friendly and I highly recommend this place if you are eating beef options.

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!!! We went there for the first time last year and now that we are back in Vegas, I can't wait until Wednesday when it opens so we can go get our food on. Very authentic and the servers are attentive and friendly. You won't be disappointed.
Wonderful service, ambiance, and food. Our waiter was concise and efficient. A fresh experience amongst a money hungry Vegas.

How can you go wrong with Mexican?  The sauces for the chips are great. Guacamole, salsa, beans.  Then off to a Mango margarita. 

I feel as though I am a chimichanga connoisseur. The flavor of the chicken chimichanga was good. The chimi was not crispy which h I like. The rest of the family liked their food



One big negative it is very loud. Can't hear yoursel

The avocado shrimp dish was delish but I was really upset with their service. When I walked up I told them I needed it to go. She said fine but I had to sit down and then ask for a to go box and said while I wait they serve  chips. The chips never came so when they brought the plate of food and the to go box for me to transfer the food to I asked for some chips that I would have gotten while waiting. They said hou don't get the chips when itsqto go, same price for the meal  it no chips. They went and asked someone else and came back and   and said again no chips. I couldn't believe the rudeness. Over 50 cents of chips. I had to go to the casino gift shop and spend $4 for a bag of chips to go with my Mexican .meal!
Mediocre food... salsa tasted too "tomato-y", guacamole was very bland, taquitos were just "ok". Much better food from the small hole-in-the-wall Mexican joints.

This is good Mexican good for a hotel. I had dinner there last night and the tacos are amazing they give you chips with three dips all amazing great service food come out fresh and hot a must try. It is high for Mexican

Our department decided to try this place for dinner after a fun time of bingo. 

The restaurant was filled to the gills with cowboys because of NFR, but they were able to find us a table even though we were an hour early for our reservation. The service was pretty good. Our drinks were refilled often. The food wasn't fantastic, although I didn't have very high expectations of the place. 

The chips and salsa were pretty disappointing. Totally flavorless. Everyone added tapatio to it to for more flavor. I ordered the pork adobo and it was ok. Nothing amazing, but it was edible. I only ate about a quarter of it and didn't feel I had missed anything. The rest of my party was pretty disappointed with their food. They know I Yelp and asked what I would rate the place and each of them gave their own star rating. I have to say most of them said two star, but I give kudos for the good service and since I actually thought my meal was ok. I rounded up for the attentive and accommodating service.

re-fried beans are AMAZING! even if i was not staying at this hotel, i would come, order a large side of the beans and chips to go and be a happy happy girl. the kicker is, i don't even usually like beans ! :)

Don't waste your time here.  This place was an absolute joke and the service and the food were terrible.

I was almost tempted to give it 2 stars because the drink waiter was great and the chips and dip you are served in the beginning are good.  But it was a steep downhill spiral from there and I want to discourage people from wasting their money here with all the other good places to eat.

First, apparently the center pieces on all of the tables in the restaurant telling you about their happy hour specials only applies to the BAR area - which was literally less than 10 feet away from where we were sitting.  Plus, my margaritas came from the same bar where the happy hour actually was only they would have been more than 50% cheaper if only I was sitting 10' in the closer direction (they have tables at the "bar area" too).  It is very misleading, the logo looked practically the same as the one for the restaurant only it says "bar" in small print at the bottom.

Second, our waiter was in a complete dream the entire time.  Terrible.  It was so obvious how terrible he was going to be as soon as he walked up to the table, it was scary.  He was very uninterested the entire time in taking our order, waiting on us in general, listening to anything we said.  There was not one thing we ordered the entire time that we didn't have to repeat at least THREE times to him and he still managed to screw it up most of the time.

We ordered the cheese quesadilla for an appetizer - he asked if we wanted the chicken quesadilla, I said, No, we want the cheese.  He said, Oh ok. He still brought us out a greasy chicken quesadilla.

We both ordered Chicken Chimichangas.  He got that part right after needing clarification multiple times, but this time the food was absolutely disgusting.  It was very obvious they pre-fry the Chimichangas and then just MICROWAVED them to reheat them to bring them out to us.  They were mushy and absolutely disgusting.  They came with the DRIEST and BLANDEST rice you have ever had and refried beans are never something that can "save a dish" that terrible.

I asked for a 2nd margarita.  Traditional, frozen, just like the first one I had.  He gave me a blank look for a moment, so I started to repeat myself then he asked if I wanted it on the rocks, I said, No, frozen.  He went to get it.  Came back with a margarita on the rocks, dropped it on the table and ran away (didn't even take away my empty one that had been sitting there).  I was so frustrated at this point, I just wanted this terrible dinner to end.

The waiter never checked on how we liked the food (the restaurant wasn't busy but it wasn't dead either - the booths around the outskirts were about full, but all the tables were empty), instead when we were maybe 1/2 way done eating, he came with his checkbook pulled out staring at our ticket obviously and asked us if we were going to be having any coffee or if we had any coupons for my margaritas??  (Didn't even ask if we wanted desert.)  We told him we were paying with a meal voucher from the casino (you earn dollars to spend based on time played there and you can redeem them for dollar amounts to spend at any of their restaurants).  He looked at us to literally stop eating so we could hand him the voucher right then.  My husband said, No you can bring me the check first.  He went away and came right back with the check and said he can take our card(payment) now.  My husband gave him the dirtiest look and said, I think I'm going to finish eating first.  The waiter said he would come back.

That's when we saw the margaritas weren't the happy hour price and noticed their deceptive advertising scandal.  My husband also noted he did see another couple a few minutes earlier hold up the center piece and ask the drink guy something, then they got up and walked to a table at the bar.  Obviously, that was why.

We didn't want to fuss over it.  My husband pulled out the voucher and paid the rest in cash.  The waiter came back and asked if I wanted a box (one of the first normal waiter things he did the entire time) since I didn't eat too much of my disgusting food.  I declined.  We paid and left just a 10% tip - one of the worst tips we've ever left and he's lucky we're not complete scumbags having been waiters ourselves, because he truly deserved nothing.
